attributes.action: set in motion a review of the Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned believe that the level of monies paid by the Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) is disproportionate to the pain and suffering caused by criminal acts.
A full review is needed when a system allows a criminal such as Peter Sutcliffe to receive a higher level of compensation than innocent people, such as Rob Thornton and Nick Horobin, suffering acts of violence while going about their day-to-day business.
We call upon the Govnernment to rectify this and allow fairer compensation for the innocent and stop payments to convicted criminals.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
